Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Hmm, how to model the optional paths? Let's think about the possible transitions... So the structure would have branches where after certain steps, there are possible loops.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: After DV, if documents are incomplete, you go to RDS. After RDS, you check again, so you loop back to DV again.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: After FC, if there's fraud, you go to II, then back to FC again. If no fraud, proceed to CA.

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Let me list all the possible places (states) in the Petri net. Each place represents a state after an activity.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Perhaps the best way is to model each step as a transition between places. Let me try to outline the transitions and their connections.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The transitions would be: DV1: after_cr -> after_dv; RDS: after_dv -> after_rds; DV2: after_rds -> after_dv, capturing the loop.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: After CA, if the amount is over the threshold, the process goes to Approval (AP). Otherwise, it directly proceeds to Payment (P).

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: The CA transition can only be fired if the token exits the II loop after FC. This needs marks, but it is simplified here for feasibility.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: After N (Notification), there is CL (Closure), marking the final state, ensuring the process reaches its terminal point.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: The initial marking starts with a token in 'start', and the final marking ends with a token in 'after_cl', ensuring correctness.
